title: Offline Bus Tracking App
shortDescription: An offline-first bus tracking app that estimates real-time bus location using nearby cell towers, with optional GPS-based tracking and privacy-friendly data handling. Built with Kotlin (Jetpack Compose), Foreground Services, Location & Telephony APIs, Python, RoomDB.
detailedDescription:
Built `HithoBus` - a unified bus tracking platform that integrates all major Indian government road transport services (UPSRTC, PBSRTC, HRSRTC, RJSRTC, and more) into a single `offline-capable` app. Unlike trains, government buses operate in a highly decentralized ecosystem with no uniform GPS mandate or data sharing, leaving passengers with long and uncertain wait times. This app solves that by providing `real-time tracking` even in rural, low-network areas through innovative `cell tower-based location inference`.

üö© **What problem it solves**
Government bus passengers face critical challenges:
- No standardized tracking system across state transport corporations
- Long, uncertain waiting times with no arrival estimates
- Limited internet connectivity in rural areas makes online tracking unreliable
- Decentralized bus operations with no GPS mandate
- Unlike trains, buses lack unified infrastructure for real-time location data

HithoBus provides a reliable `offline-first` solution that works even without active internet by leveraging `cell tower proximity` and `crowdsourced GPS` data.

üõ†Ô∏è **My Contributions (Team Leader)**
- `Led team of 4 developers` in `architecting` and building the complete tracking system
- `Designed and implemented` the mobile UI using `Jetpack Compose` with `Material 3`
- `Engineered` the core `offline tracking algorithm` using cell tower triangulation and route-aware tower matching
- Implemented continuous GPS monitoring and cell tower detection using `TelephonyManager API` (supporting both modern TelephonyCallback and legacy PhoneStateListener for `backward compatibility`)
- Built `dual-mode tracking`: Cell tower-based (offline) + GPS crowdsourcing (online)
- Developed `foreground services` with persistent notifications for `background location tracking`
- Integrated `Fused Location Provider` for optimized `battery-efficient` GPS updates (15-second polling interval)
- Created `Room database schema` for local storage of tower metadata and route mappings
- Implemented `Retrofit`-based `REST API` client with polling mechanism for server communication
- Applied `MVVM` + `Hilt DI` architecture with `Kotlin Coroutines/Flow` for `reactive` location streams
- Coordinated with backend team for `API design` and `MongoDB` integration

‚öôÔ∏è **Technical Highlights**
**Offline Cell Tower Tracking:**
- Fetches route data from `GeoJSON` files via `Node.js` backend
- Maintains towers.json database of cell towers along bus routes
- Uses `TelephonyManager` to detect currently connected cell tower
- Compares detected tower with `Room database` to resolve approximate bus location
- If tower not found ‚Üí prompts user to contribute GPS data (`crowdsourcing`)

**GPS Crowdsourcing System:**
- Users inside buses share `real-time location` via `Fused Location Provider`
- Location updates every 15 seconds (`battery-optimized`)
- Data sent to server via `Retrofit` with polling mechanism
- Server calculates nearest bus stop and `arrival estimates`
- Outside users fetch live location from crowdsourced GPS pool

**Android Services Implementation:**
- `Foreground services` with persistent notifications (system compliance)
- `Lifecycle-aware` tracking jobs with `structured concurrency`
- Automatic cancellation and restart of tracking loops
- Speed calculation and `ETA estimation`
- Support for both modern Android APIs (31+) and `legacy versions`

**Full-Stack Integration:**
- `MongoDB` backend for `scalable` route and tower storage
- `Python` scripts (Pandas, GeoPandas) for route processing
- `Express REST APIs` for location polling and route fetching
- `Google Maps SDK` for route visualization

üìà **Impact**
- Enables bus tracking in `rural and low-network areas` where online solutions fail
- Provides `unified platform` for multiple state transport corporations
- Reduces passenger wait time uncertainty with `ETA calculations`
- `Crowdsourcing model` continuously improves tower database coverage
- Demonstrates `advanced Android system integration` (telephony, location, services)
- `Battery-efficient` design suitable for extended usage
- `Real-world solution` addressing India's decentralized bus infrastructure challenge
